Description: Lower body sherd of South Ionian black-figured pottery little-master cup; interior, from outside: black area, reserved band, black band, zone with trace of black-figure decoration on a background of dilute lines; exterior: band of triple staggered dots between sets of three black lines; glazed below with two added red lines.
Type series: Schlotzhauer little master Ionian Cup type
Curator's comments: The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.860. The decorative motif finds parallels with Schlotzhauer's South Ionian little master cups and South Ionian cups with everted rim Type 9C. Type 9C cups correspond to Attic Siana, Band, and Gordion cups and find parallels with Hayes' Ionian Cup Type XI (Boardman and Hayes 1966, 111-116). The Type 9 shape evolved from the earlier Type 5 cup shape. Type 5 cups are rare at Naukratis whereas there are numerous examples of Type 9 cups. Both types were common drinking vessels found in Greeks sanctuaries, including the sanctuary of Aphrodite at Miletus.
Also treated by Emil Kunze in Ath.Mitt. 59 (1934) 93-4, Beilage 7, 3.
Bibliographic references: Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (p. 129, no. 448, pl. 53, no. 448)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 112, NAU 70, pl. 15 d-g)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GE.741) (Phase 3)
